lines.text: That's kind of perfect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about to say, would you like a Manual of Quickness? Here, for you-- (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, for the next century?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So 99 years from now--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure, I'll hold onto it for that long.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When we're all cold and dead!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was holding onto it in the hopes of finding somebody long-lived to sell it to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Speaking of old, are some of us older than we used to be?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we still old? It would have worn off, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say, for the purposes of the travel, because you guys had a few days' travel from the actual Sphinx's lair, towards Westruun when you were travellng back, you had the opportunity to use Greater Restoration to get rid of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Between Pike and I--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, in that time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What if we don't want to be any younger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Then you could have said no and kept it as you go. If you wanted to take in your nice salt and pepper--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How old are you now, Scanlan, if you keep it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That salt and pepper hair?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A girl never tells her age.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Would you want to maintain your little creeping Reed Richards going on at the sides there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'll get young again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Slightly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Slightly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He said, begrudgingly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Set that dial back to 39.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right then. Anything else?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What were you going to say, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was thinking, perhaps, you're not necessarily the person to magically augment your path.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's kind of my hesitance about it, I guess.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had meditated upon the idea for a minute.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm honestly kind of afraid of what kind of leadership things and influence it could possibly tell me. I don't know. I don't know. I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You can read it, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes! (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At the very least, it'll keep him busy for four or five days.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's true. That's true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Because you have to read for 48 hours--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if he gets even more charismatic and then he proposes again? And he charms you more?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, if he's so charming, I just wouldn't be able to help it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's possible.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know, that's my-- actually, my only other regret is do we want to turn Scanlan into a charm nuclear weapon? Because that's what we'll be doing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I kind of do want to do that. He is super good at talking to people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I think there's enough of us that we could all keep each other in check, from--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Between Grog and Scanlan, we can solve any problem, I think, so beef him up, so to speak.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell me what kind of leadership things-- who wrote that, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lao Tsu.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell me what kind of leadership skills Lao Tsu wants to bestow upon you. If there's any good ones, pass them along.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'll give you some tips.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) All right. You guys finish your breakfast, make your way outside of the mansion, back into the dragon's den. Is there anything else you wish to do before you leave? As you can only take the amount of gold that you retrieved, and the items you could farm, the rest will have to be left behind, hopefully to be retrieved at some point down the line by either the remnants of Westruun or yourselves.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll just say that I've attuned to all my old shit while everyone was swimming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah. I carved a pretty little heart on the side of one of the boots just to make it extra girly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would just think that meant you love me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe I do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Uh, that is a 39.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) What?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 17 plus perception is-- did I get it wrong? Am I too tired? I've had a long day, people. Let's say 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you take perception as one of your--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, then yeah. Okay. You take the boots and you put them on and immediately, there's a heart there. And you're like (pained) hmm. That probably means she loves me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I like it. It's fine!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. At first you're like, sh-- oh no, it's cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know what you're thinking. It's beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you guys are back in the dragon's lair. Is there anything else you wish to do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to make sure we walk around the trap that is still active in the front--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make your way back through the tunnel that you had carved before--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have to avoid that old magic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there any lasting damage from the acid burns?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thankfully, through magic healing and other means there was no scarring. The tattoos and beard that were partially destroyed--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was going to ask: beard?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the beard's a little bit reduced from the sheer volume of acid that was thrown at your face but since healing magic was applied shortly thereafter, the little bit of the beard that began to singe, it stopped that process. So you still have some facial hair, just may have to grow back to its full majesty--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I may need a haircut in a day or two.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or, actually, one tooth if that would be all right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. Tooth me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to leave the "VM" seal on the side of the cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And just written in-- what would a dragon understand?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Draconic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Draconic?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have somebody who can do that--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: "One down" and let's embed the tooth into the rock.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! I like it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We might as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like it. I like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I do the Vox Machina crest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And then "one down." Who speaks Draconic?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go ahead and copy that and you embed it permanently and immediately into the side of the stone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And I said, bitch!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. You guys make your way down Gatshadow, through the Bramblewood Forest to Westruun itself. As you hit the base of the mountain, start getting towards the edge of the forest, you see a pillar of smoke rising up from that direction--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: From Westruun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A relatively thick pillar of smoke, a few actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait. What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Uh-oh. They've already attacked.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we go fast. We go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They haven't noticed you yet. And standing behind them all, one large aimless stone golem with a big chain hanging out of its chest, just standing there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fassbender!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who controls him?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No one at the moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you took it off?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I took it off.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But you have the circlet still.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Of course I have the circlet, yeah, but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll take it if no one else does.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I find my way to Zanror? Is his-- is she his wife? His woman--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His mate, Worra. Yeah, they're both next to each other and as you get closer you notice most of them have gathered their belongings. They have travel packs. They have taken sacks and whatever they could to bring whatever belonged to them and it looks like they are getting ready to move. You see Shale a bit behind them, as well, who has also taken some small supplies with her one good arm and putting it over her shoulder and tying it to her armor before she grabs her staff again. So you walk over to Zanror and Worra. Zanror looks over to you as you approach, his arm still around Worra's shoulder. "It's good to see you survived, Grog."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Did more than that, actually. Found our way up to the cave where Umbrasyl was. Left him in pieces.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "As Shale told us. 'The Bearded King,' she said."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) A word of advice. If, as you're finding your way out of town, you were to stop by a certain cave, there might be some things for you to pick up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gro--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take my sister, put my hand over her mouth, and I drag her back about 30 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He gives you a look, and looks to Worra, looks to her belly--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) That's for the people of Westruun!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --and goes, "Appreciate that. We'll take what we can."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Her. It.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I will."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Do you want to come with us? We know we cast you out once, but we're not like that "anymore. The herd's dead. We go to find prosperity with the Rivermaw. A people we wronged and we're "probably going to spend some time making it up to them, for my father's infractions. You're one of "us now, and we'd be honored to have you."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm honored. Truly I am. But I lost a family, all those years ago. And while I will always think fondly of you, I have a new family now, and I must stay and guard them with my life.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I understand. Well. I'm not very good at these parting pleasantries." He puts his arm out.

lines.name: MATT, TRAVIS
lines.text: (crashing sound)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stereo.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, it blew your hair back when it happened.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, a little bit, little bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Magnavox, like (squeal sound)!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You be safe. You find your way, head north of the Silvercut. You're always welcome in our tents."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll keep that in mind. Travel safely.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He goes ahead and takes up his bags. Shale takes up her staff, comes up to you, and: "We'll "see each other again, Grog. Of this I'm sure."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Hm, totally sure, heh. You look out for that other eye now. Don't lose the other, because then you'll just be like (scared noise) in the dark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zanror yells out, "Come! We move west." Everyone turns their heads and gather their things and they walk by. As all the soldiers walk by, those wounded and not, to each of you they bow their heads in respect. And you swear you hear a couple of murmured "thank you" as they all solemnly make their way out west, away from Westruun.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is it just the remainder of the herd?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Herd leader! We trust you will leave something in that cave for the people of this town. Something to help them recover.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zanror turns to you, and says, "There's very little in our lifestyle that really has use of "this coin, just enough to make it from place to place if need be. Besides, occasionally we need "supplies, something to trade with. I'm not like my father. This I've learned in recent months."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Prosperity on your family.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hm." Looks to Grog. "Your family as well." Turns around and continues to walk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're lucky he's nice, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What, what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Offering all the gold to the herd instead of the people of Westruun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't offer all of it. I said there was something to pick up. He might have grabbed a bunch of mud, what are you so upset about?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He meant well.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys make your way-- uh, where are you heading?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Into Westruun?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is the gold pile trap still there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is, yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's sprung. We have to pick it up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is our gold still there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a good thing I only put a little bit in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to go take like five minutes. I'm going to kneel down and sort of meditate in front of one of the pyres.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (laughing) But what you do notice, ironically, while the gold is still there, it's scattered about. Because there's been an explosion where the gold was left behind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: My bad. I made a bomb!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nearby, there is a groove in the dirt that is dragged on for about four, five hundred feet, before there appears to be a body at the edge.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dead dwarf?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a dwarf?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (shouting)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That son of a bitch! That thieving bastard?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He deserves it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The fucking asshole that peaced out!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Blackfoot-- what was his name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oran Blackfoot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's what he thought he was going to do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good kill. Good kill.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right, all right, all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm taking a moment to pay my respects to the dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do the same.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm attuning Fassbender. And working on getting the chain removed from him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth takes a minute to Druidcraft some wildflowers around the pyre.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you guys are taking this break, Vex, you notice a small group of individuals walking from the town in your direction. Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bent my paper. (high voice) 17!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You glance over and, best you can make out, some appear to be armored, some appear to be just carrying sacks and goods. There's a cart being dragged behind with two beasts of burden affixed to the front, a set of horses, and at the front of them you see a human male wearing chain mail with a heavy shield to one side, walking up and approaching. He's mid to late 40s, big black- and gray-streaked beard pulled into two points, wild crazy-looking dark hair, also gray streaked. Sun-dappled nose. He walks up with his hand in the air.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oi, friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Can we go ahead and have our guest enter?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know that guy! (cheers)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry for the wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We had to have a hot spring episode.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Very important cannonball competition we had to get to.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'm sorry that I was laughing loud enough for the mics to pick it up. Some people on Twitter were saying that they heard me laugh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's fine. Patrick Rothfuss, joining us today!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fabulous writer. Good person.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: That's not me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, as you're walking up from the city of Westruun, carrying behind you the group of eager-to-leave refugees that have gathered around you, you notice the burning spires, and you see the remnants of the horde leaving westward behind the group of heroes that you all had feared had gone to the top of the mountain to meet their doom. They stand before you alive and resting, and as you approach to hail them, one of them, the half-elf female, hails you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sir, how fares-- (stuttering) How are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Charisma!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Give me the book. Give me the book!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Amazing. Couldn't have done any better.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's happening in the town? Are you leaving?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: How many people are left in town and how many have come with me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In town, there's probably a couple hundred that are scattered throughout. Most of them have left, the party has sent them out, but many individuals that they didn't get to have still been holed up in their homes. You have with you right now 20 people, and these are the folks that have congregated around you to figure out a plan of what to do.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's with all the questions, narc? (laughter)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I will admit I did not expect to see you folk again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we're here.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: What's happened?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know that dragon?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I noticed the dragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Give me the book.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I don't know what to say. I was expecting to have to bury some more bodies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thankfully, that is not the case. And you are smart, with leaving town.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: But now, at least we can make some plans.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi, what's your name?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Oh. My name is Kerr.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kerr?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like Care Bear?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that with a C or a K?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: (laughs) With a K.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Kerr. I like it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And tell us about yourself, if you don't mind.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I have been here in this town for a while. I settled down after-- I had a bit of an adventurous youth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! I like!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, me too.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: How old do these guys look?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They look younger than you. They look like a bunch of young upstarts, for the most part.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: They're puppies, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're puppies, but looking close up, you can see weathered experiences in their eyes.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: They came back from the dragon. But still, these are like kids, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From your perspective? Yeah.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm an adult man!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's just roughly past your knee.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I welcome you back to what is left of the town, and I offer my thanks, and thanks on behalf of those of us that are left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you responsible for these pyres?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: The town has been pulling together, and we have been doing what we can with what we have.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And what's your position been in Westruun?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'm just the smith.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're a blacksmith?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You make weapons?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Armor?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Armor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I make things. They're not--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe you guys could collab on a joint project.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Smithing and gadgetry, while I can see how, to the layman, they look very similar, are in fact quite different.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I actually might have a project for you, if we have a moment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, before we start hitting him up for work.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is this everybody you could round up to get out of the city?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Well, this is everyone who was interested in coming out on this particular expedition.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yeah! What is your expedition?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Mostly exploratory. Like I said, we just didn't have any information at all. I didn't know if we were going to be burying more bodies, or dealing with an increasingly angry dragon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, the dragon in the mountain is dead, but there are increasingly angered dragons in other cities that will probably be coming here to retaliate.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: That will be coming here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Possibly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: More than likely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Probably.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do the people of Westruun do at this point? Do they rebuild? Do they go underground? Do they leave and abandon the city?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a huge question, yes. What do you think, personally? What is this small group that you're leading? What's your plan?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I offered to come along with them in case they needed a strong arm. I don't speak for the town. I just know most of the people involved, and I wanted to make sure they stayed safe. But the truth is, there's a lot of people who have nothing to rebuild, and nothing to rebuild it with. And if there might be dragons coming back, I don't know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, Kerr, Pike and I are both from Westruun. Yeah. Yep.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I've seen you before. Do you know Wilhand? My great-great-grandfather?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great great?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Great-great. Yeah. Two greats, not just one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A tiny, hunched over gnomish gentleman, a little absent-minded but friendly enough, keeps to himself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Likes to drink.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Ah!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes. You probably have had some drinks with him before.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: A little bit. And I haven't met you, but I've heard of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yeah?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What have you heard?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I heard that you were a good member of the community.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep, that's me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope. You are incorrect.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Totally.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He was, and is, but we're just never home.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Grog. Grog is my name.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kerr, do you have a sense of how many people are left in the city, roughly?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Maybe as many as a couple hundred.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not a lot.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: A lot of people have been leaving, but some people can't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, look, I would just like to put this forward. Westruun is their home. It's Pike's home, it's my home. And if you start running, you never really stop.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But where are they going to stay? I've been down to the sewers, and there's crazy giant creatures down there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, you can treat it like a weather shelter. If the dragons come, we set up an early warning system. They go underground. But this is their home.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Here's an interesting thing to contemplate about this whole problem, is that we have three dragons still at large. Three dragons who have probably found cities of their own, so the chances that they're going to come back and take time away from their own city to go look at one that's, in theory, already taken over is very thin. And if they are traveling, then they're going to travel to cities that haven't been plundered yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true, this one has been plundered.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is no less or more. There's a risk either way. It's just the risk of running or the risk of staying.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also the dragons know that the last dragon who came here died.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think the dragons' motives have probably shifted by now, and where the dragons might not be interested in plundering anymore, instead might be interested in any city that we are in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which, I imagine we're leaving soon, anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, they might not believe we'd be here, but they also might try to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kerr, are you an honest man?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I've been called an honest man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I insight check him!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may both make insight checks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (high voice) Four.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If you whisper to Grog, it's going to make me really happy. Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He just said, you fart.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mightily.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Excuse me for just a minute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was this about Loot Crate?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three dollars off if you use lootcrate.com/criticalrole next week!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But that's no secret!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I trust him with my life. I pledge my allegiance to you, sir.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You just dabbed to him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan literally hasn't said that to me in the entire three years I've known him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was your name again?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Scanlan just found out that Kerr has a daughter, is what he found out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow, you pledge your life to him? Jeez.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kerr. You said you were an adventurer several years ago.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Many years ago. Many years ago. I've lived here-- I've lived here a lifetime at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you have a party that you traveled with as well?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would we happen to know any of them? Allura? Asum?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: No, that was a long time ago, and I'd be very surprised if you'd heard any of the stories from back then. I will say, though, from what I know about dragons, that perhaps vengeance might not be outside a reasonable expectation. There might not be anything here for them to plunder, but--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But no one likes having their ass handed to them.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And these creatures are old and intelligent and powerful, and they stay that way by striking fear into people. And (sighs) as much as I hate to leave my own home, I don't know who will be able to help my people if any other things like this happen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can't be everywhere at once.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about the sewers?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we were down there, and there was horrible, creepy things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We could help with that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could clear out the sewers.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But that's not indefinite.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, it's not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They'll be back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The only other option is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's the traveling band, by the river.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Split the city up? Set them on different paths?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's Whitestone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whitestone is rapidly becoming a very large target.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Very quickly becoming noticeable, I think.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ever been to Vasselheim?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Refugees are often very unwelcome, too, and most of the people here did not have much left to lose before they lost it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's up in the mountain. It's just hard to get down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Someone honest is going to have to come and help divvy it up amongst the survivors.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: We can look for an honest person.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But if all of the survivors are evacuating the city--

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: We could probably-- I know enough people to put together a group of carters to go up there and start fetching stuff down?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. And the people that have gathered around you are people that have been around you most of the time you've been in the city, or at least have known you long enough to the point where they themselves are also like-minded, so you can trust most of the folks that have walked with you out towards the pyres.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'll say, excuse me for just a minute, and I'll walk off and I'll chat with them a little bit, so you can see that I'm pointing up. I'll do a little talk off with them, so you can talk about me behind my-- Without me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I like this guy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why do you pledge yourself to him?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I just feel like he's an honest man. He's a good guy. He's got a nice twinkle in his eye and I recognize that as a sign of honesty, because I have a similar feature.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You do? I've never noticed a twinkle in your eye.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, the light has to hit it just--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, it's a crusty from the morning. You might just-- yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How do you get glitter in there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That seems like such a shame. I mean, shouldn't we ask the people of Westruun if they want to stay or go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, there's only 200. We could have a huge meeting and put it to a vote.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A town hall thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why not?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But he said some people were incapable of leaving. There might be elderly and sick here that can't travel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a way to hide the city with magic? We've seen that done before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we make it look like it's already been burned down?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It has already been burned down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That won't be hard at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we hide?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can't they have sentries and a shelter in the sewers? They could clear out part of it and have sentries every night, and any time a dragon comes, they just go underground and wait. Wait it out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think this is a terrible-- I think this is a pretty reasonable idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you think, Grog, Pike?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I said.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like it's a good idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I don't--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hang on, hold the phone. Hold the phone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could spend a few days here and get them started before we go on to our next thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's so hard to find shelter and protection that's not a city where you're unwelcome in the first place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, this is an unwelcome world at the moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could leave Fassbender here to help protect everyone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I guess if we gave him away. But we need him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we need him?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's going to slow us down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How are we going to get Fassbender anywhere with us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tell him to walk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we returning the band?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, Quall did want the circlet at some point. It's not necessarily ours to give away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Quall's evil.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is he?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Selfish, maybe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are under contract, technically.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What were you going to say, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We could just leave it with Wilhand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We could leave it with Wilhand, actually.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And then we could tell Quall--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, Quall, we didn't know where you were, we couldn't find you, we left it with Wilhand.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We wanted to leave it in one place, just in case we see you again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that your lying voice?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry, buddy.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: What is the general atmosphere in town? Are people just done?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, right? I'm fucking over this shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're probably eager to leave for the time being. Some of them do want to stay just because they're stubborn, but the majority seems interested in not being in a place that could be a target for more dragon attacks, as rumors have come back that there is more than just the black dragon, and many of them recall the red, the green, and the white that came with the initial onslaught that tore through the city. Or it would've been the green and the white.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Okay, yeah. So I'll wander back, and I say, my friends here are willing to go on a retrieval mission. I'm assuming you folks could use some rest, and the hospitality of the town isn't what it used to be, but I'm sure a lot of people would be very glad to see you. Have you set up protections? Did you hide the treasure?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We did. We did. It's hidden in a cubby with a little mark on it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll give you instructions.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Sketch out something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Including a little walk around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah, the walk around is important.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But there are stuff out there in the woods. There are things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's a strong man.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And I've got, these are the more capable, these folks can go out on their own?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A number of them can, yeah. Some of them were there for general visual support, carrying things forth and stewards that have taken up arms because they have to, but you're essentially the strongest of a group of relatively capable individuals.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd hate to send you into anything that all of a sudden got a bit too nasty. I see you wearing chain mail. If I may, what is your weapon of choice?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'm partial-- I was partial to the warhammer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh. I reach out to shake his hand. I like your choice.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Kerr, do you know how to make armor be quiet? (laughter)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I've been there. I lived there a long time. We could talk shop about that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I love talking shop. Let's do it.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'll set up a little expedition and I'll send people out, knowing that a lot of these folks that are here are going to head out. They're going to need resources, and based on what they've said, my team can go out and get some of this treasure?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, based on the description they've said and the sheer volume that's there, they end up taking four carts that are capable of doing a somewhat treacherous mountain journey with the strong individuals you send up as well. I don't know if you wanted to go up with them or stay behind.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: It sounds reasonably clear. We'll send up a good group with spare parts, and they're all craftsmen here, they're all farmers, they can fix a cart if it breaks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there any way for them to contact you if shit goes down while they're up there? If we need to go in as the cavalry to the rescue?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Are there any--?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can send one of the stones with them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Anybody with cantrippy message sending--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, anybody with any modicum of arcane practitioning capability left.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: They beat feet long ago. Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as shit hit the fan, they were like, nope!

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I think at this point, it's people that are stubborn and with really low intelligence scores are the only folks left, so the wizards went right away.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's appropriate on occasion to leave people to a modicum of risk. Life is risky. It's perfectly reasonable to send people on themselves.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we steer them away from the area where we ran into those basilisks?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, we will tell you about the basilisks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're locals. They should know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the basilisks were far south. That was in the Frostweald.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as you know, they were nowhere near the Bramblewood, thankfully.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So what should we do here, clear out the sewers? Because that's what was said.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, there's three options for these people, and they have to decide for us. They can stay here and live in the sewers. They can go to, what's it called?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kymal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kymal, where they're still accepting refugees, or they can wander off into the desert.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, there's also that group of people wandering around. There's that group.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's what I'm saying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, guys, so remember the farmer? Outside, and then he turned into a scarecrow?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, we remember.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I found his daughter.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, where is she?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you tell her?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, I didn't know what to do. She looked like a deer in the headlights.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where is she?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She was in the prison with Abjurist Noja and Blackfoot, who's now dead. What's her name again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Amelia.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Amelia, really sweet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you send her towards refugees?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is she around?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I brought her out before we took the fight to the dragon, so I think she's still in the town, but I don't want to tell her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should tell her, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I know, and maybe give her a little coin, but, Pike, do you think maybe you could--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Tell her?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I remember where he is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where Reginald is? Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I head off that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's directly west of the town, so it's pretty much south of where you guys are currently standing, because the drop point was northwest of the city. He is still affixed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I bring him back here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Make him sound real brave, you know. Paint a good picture when you talk to her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He was real brave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's only about 200 people left. Do you know someone named Amelia?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She was a little shamed by it, but you calmed her down. But you do know that she's safe and reachable.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah, she's around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where is everyone staying within the town? Are they scattered about or are they staying in a central location?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: It's makeshift, but-- because it's been a couple of days, at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's been almost two days since the initial encounter.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I will say, some people are going to stay no matter what, and they have the right to stay, and that's their choice. I imagine some people will come back and rebuild here, but most people, they are ready to go. They miss their families.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: An entire city.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can build a dragon shelter. At the very least, that is something we can do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But these people are prisoners here. They feel like they're prisoners in their own home, and that's not a home.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Then we let them make their choice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They'll do what they're going to do, but we can give them an option if things get hairy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's make our way toward them, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The largest concentration of survivors that you've been keeping tabs on actually aren't that far from Wilhand's home, in the area where most of the temples are constructed, which is generally considered one of the oldest and most protected areas of Westruun. There are two inns that are basically now ramshackle homes for sleep. There's bedspreads across the entire floor, all the tables and chairs have been moved out, and it's now just a giant room where people who had their homes destroyed come and sleep, not because it's comfortable, but because there's comfort and safety in numbers. People have gathered what belongings they still had that are worth anything or they might need for a journey. Many of them are still gathering bits of dried food and fruit and whatever, preparing for whatever the next step of their travels may be. But you probably have the bulk of the people in the town, other than a few older, very stubborn folks that are like, "I'm going to stay in my home!" The folks that stayed at Mt. St. Helens, where you're like, come on, guys, seriously? (laughter)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: There's always some.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's always some. But yeah, so as you approach and the door swings open to the first tavern, as you introduce them too, a few of the folks perk up. A few children who couldn't sleep look over. Two of the kids that recognize you run up, "Uncle Kerrek!" They run up and grab the side of your legs. Your chain mail clanks and you pick them up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I look around for Wilhand.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wilhand is not amongst this group. Wilhand probably stayed safe within his home, which kept him safe up to this point, so far.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we see Amelia?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking about, yes, you do see Amelia. She is asleep right now, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wake her up! Tell her her dad's dead!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, hey. It's really important. I need to tell you right now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We see her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see her. She's asleep. It's later in the day from the travel, you guys went down the mountain to even get here after you woke up in the morning. You spent most of the day getting back to Westruun, so you're getting pretty close to sunset. The group has been set off for the evening's travel toward the top of Gatshadow. She appears to have fallen asleep early.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'll start a few things, and I'll spread the word. Everybody could really use a bit of a party here. We don't have many resources, but I'm betting there's enough liquor for everybody to get good and drunk tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: That's the resource there's always an abundance of at this point. We'll kind of put the word out, and honestly, I don't need to organize it. I can just say, "Dragon's dead, and they did "it. We're going to throw them a party tonight." And I'm just going to let that happen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with each chain of that word spreading, the energy immediately lifts up within the room, and the building adjacent, and folks that were either resting or in a state of perpetual anxiousness suddenly brighten up, even with the dirt-smeared faces, you can see smiles poking out as people begin coming into the room to see those who slew the dragon that threatened them. People start coming up and shaking your hands, individuals who haven't seen you guys for years, people that lived down the street and gave you a passing hello in the younger days of your youth, are now coming up to you with a look of absolute appreciation and thanks. Just as that energy picks up, the wine and the ale begin to go throughout the area as stores of them beneath the taverns that were not found by the herd, as there were only so many members of the herd and a larger number of actual inns and taverns throughout the town, people start grabbing cups. Even some of the kids start coming up with cups, and the parents are like, "Hmm, a little." It's New Year's, you can have a sip.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's medieval times, everybody drinks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You sent the last of the decent bards out of town. It's all on you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I hang out outside? I want to keep my eye on the skies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, not a worry. Go ahead and make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about to say I was going to join you. I've had my fill of party.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I'm sure you were.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, what is that? 32.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: People clinking glasses together. And in this tiny little microcosm of a moment here, you let yourself silently smile, and really know what all of this is worth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to join--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: About that time I reach and grab Percy's hand before he leaves the door. Percy. Percy!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's a lot of people here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it about your feelings about Vax? Is that the whole problem right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I really don't--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's so many people calling us heroes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're not heroes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We pretty much are, actually. I hate to tell you this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're terrible people. Why are they telling us this? Oh, god. Oh, god, if I have to shake one more townsperson's hand. Oh, god. I feel like I was cursed. I was cursed. I don't want any of this. I don't want any of this!

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Do I spot that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. As you guys are having this conversation, Kerr walks over with a rosy grin on his face.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Is this your first time?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (hyperventilating) Hi. I'm Keyleth. Do you want to step outside?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I come back inside.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Let's step outside.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys pass Vex as she steps back into the tavern, passing you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pat her on the back. Drunk? Already?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, not enough.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Panic attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you step outside with Kerr, the cold night air comforting to you, hitting your face, hitting your lungs. It helps the breathing slow, and you have a moment of control over your emotions.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (groan) Does the nausea always happen? Is that always a thing?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Is it the people, or is it the fact that you have finally realized how pointless it all is? (surprised laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it's the fact that I feel like I've been lied to my entire god damn life, and it's all crashing down upon me right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's druish.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So druish. So yeah, you could say-- how about a little bit of column A and a little bit of column B?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. How did you deal with it?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I found other places where I could do good things.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like what?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Like, I make wagon couples. The thing that hooks--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. I don't know exactly what you said.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: You have a wagon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And then you have a horse.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, yeah.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And then something needs to hook the horse to the wagon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Got you.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And if you have a bad one of those, it breaks, and so people need good ones of those.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know at all what you just told me. I'm not going to lie. But I think I get the message.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'm guessing that you are bothered by the fact that no matter what you do, you seem to end up destroying more things than you fix.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes! Jeez, you're like the first person-- no one else gets it.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: They don't get it, do they?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, they don't.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that it? That's it? We will destroy everything we touch? We will cause more harm than good? We will carve a path of destruction and make it seem like we're doing good, and then people will worship us because they think we're heroes, when in the back of my head I'm thinking about all the death that has come by our hands?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: That can be a lot of it. I'm not going to lie to you about that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you know, Kerr, you're not really helping make me feel better about this. I'm not going to lie.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Well I imagine that your friends will tell you a lot of things that would make you feel real good. But I'm not one for short term solutions. I think that you're right. I think that you've obviously put a lot of thought into this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So much thought. I swear I've gotten nosebleeds. Keep going. That's beside the point.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: People who are very sensitive to this sort of thing. I have been the sort of person you are. And it's not simple. Your friend who lived here for a while, the big one, what's his name?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog. Yeah.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Right. He doesn't have this. He has the opposite of this. It's all good for him, right? And you're kind of jealous, aren't you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I so badly wish I could have what he has.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: But somebody has to look at the big picture. And sometimes that's us, and usually it's unpleasant. But somebody needs to do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So you're saying this is my curse? This is my duty?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'm saying that-- (long pause). I'm saying that if you aren't careful, it will rip you apart from the inside, but that's not a long-term solution. That's just another piece of destruction. You need to find a way to live with the fact that you do what you can, because that's what you can control. And sometimes bad things happen anyway, and so you just have to decide where you're going to pick your hill. You find your hill. Everybody gets one hill, and you plant your flag and you can die on that one. But you have to be careful, because you only get one. If you're really unlucky, you get more than one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And what if the ultimate problem is that I feel like I've had zero control from the start, since birth? I didn't want any of this. I didn't want my abilities. I didn't know I was special until now. And I so desperately just want to be normal. I want to go back to being ignorance and bliss.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Then I do have a momentary, short-term solution for you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shoot.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: It will help a little bit for now. It will smooth out some of the rough edges long enough for us to talk for a while. Because I've been down this road. Okay? The thing is, you're not wrong, and you're not crazy, but it's not hopeless, either.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Thank you.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'll do maybe one of these. It feels like she wants one of these.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I can read that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I give in. Yeah. Yeah. You know, Kerr.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Even surrounded--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Chroma Conclave sends its regards! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So Game of Thrones.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As he brings you into a warm hug, and at first, there is the resistance because this is a person you don't know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, and my headdress is a little wonky.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A little wonky due to the drink, due to not concentrating. However, as much as you travel with your friends, this stranger has seemingly come to you with more wisdom and understanding of your continuous predicaments than anybody has in a long time, if at all, and you give into the hug and realize just how nice it is to have somebody understand.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was pretty much going to say that in character, but yeah, that's pretty much what I feel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, no, that's-- I wasn't-- Yeah. Yeah. I tell Kern--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kern?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Car. Kerr.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Somewhere in that neighborhood.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Care Bear. I tell Kerr, even surrounded by friends, I often feel so alone. Thank you for being a friend, even though we just met.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I get that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He brings you in. Gets you another drink.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Actually, I'll bring another drink out to her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, perfect. All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's crowded inside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I stumble outside for a bit as well at this point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Meanwhile, I'm telling my table a story about how I won a cannonball contest last night.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are enraptured.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is Amelia awake at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Amelia has woken up due to the sound and noise, and she's wandering about with a drink in her hand now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right. We'll walk over to her.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll stay with you, but just behind you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Amelia?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hi, yes! Thank you again for releasing me from the terrible stocks. I really appreciate "that. Thank you for everything you've done for Westruun."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've heard amazing things about you and your family.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're meager folk. We come from very simple roots. I--" And she takes a big, long sip of her flagon, sets it down on the table and wipes her mouth. "Truth be told, I-- as soon as I saw that "dragon, I ran straight away. I didn't-- You guys are the heroes. I didn't do anything."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I sit down next to her.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I sit down next to her, too. (whispers) Should we just wait till the morning?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to do it right now. So. We knew-- your father is Reginald.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. Have you seen him?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. He-- I take her hands. One of the bravest men I've ever had the honor of meeting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's recognition in her eyes. Her head pulls back a bit. Her expression goes stoic as she sinks in the wordless reality that you've just bestowed upon her.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know this can be-- I know how hard this is to hear. But none of this would have happened, none of this celebration would be possible without him. He sacrificed himself, so that all of us could live, and he spoke your name in the end. He wanted nothing more than for you to be taken care of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (long pause) "That sounds like Dad." Wipes her eyes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would you like to pray, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know if you're a woman of faith, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What faith do you belong to?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I follow Sarenrae.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then, for the night, as do I." She reaches over and takes her flagon, and the tears are streaming down her face in spite of her smile, and she looks to you both, and looks to you. "To "Reginald. To Dad."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To Reggie.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: To Reggie.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And she starts weeping into her hands.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Amelia. You should also know, your father was a man of a few tricks. He told us that he had been saving this up for whenever you were old enough, but I think you should have it now. I hand her 400 gold pieces.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks up for a moment. "How? How did-- they took everything."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He hid it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This could help a lot of us. Okay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think he knew you would do well with it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dear, there's more coming to the town. You take care of yourself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (deep breath) "We'll take care of each other. I think that's what he'd want."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aye.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She grabs her flagon again and takes a big old sip, sets it down. Her eyes are dried a little bit. She wipes the last away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I pour my flagon into hers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is it morning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone wakes up extremely hungover, but in a way that is well-earned and still worthy of the evening that transpired before it. You all come to consciousness, about midday at this time now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all slept in after what happened.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I actually spent the night in a field with Reginald.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ew.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's your brain, man. I sat next to his body, waiting for people to come back, they never did. I piled some of Keyleth's flowers on his chest, and then I fell asleep, in the field, six feet away from him. Party!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you think we were going to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never mind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know what I thought, but that's what I did.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why didn't you check up on the earring, dude?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wanted some space.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You start realizing that Vax is nowhere to be found and as this conversation begins to progress, he eventually finds you guys and waltzes into the groaning room of semi-conscious Westruun denizens.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (yawns) Where were you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Getting a good night's sleep on a field of grass. How are you doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We had a bender.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You need some water?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you make some?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In that endless jug? Or does it only make beer and mayonnaise?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Say water to the endless jug.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, it makes water.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It seems like a waste.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Give me water like the ocean!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, no, no, no!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The jug is now filled with water to the top.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, look! Water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it saltwater?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I dip my finger in and take a taste.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is saltwater.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (groans) Damn it, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did I do it wrong?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You did it wrong.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You should try that, though. See if you like it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there anybody else sleeping in the room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a few folks that are probably still sleeping off the drinking, but I'd say the majority of the folks have woken up in various states of grogginess.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispers) Hey, should we wake up the rest of the people with this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The people who've lost their city? You're going to prank them?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I go outside and I dump it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I cast a Create Water spell so we can all have some water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably call everyone in the town to talk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we should have a big meeting, let them decide what they want to do with the rest of their fucking lives.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What did you have to drink last night?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is there a bartender or somebody that's running the inn that everyone's staying at? Or is it kind of makeshift--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just kind of makeshift. However, whoever who once ran this place is no longer here, probably left with the first or second wave of evacuees. Everyone here is just kind of doing their part to keep it going.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I grab someone nearby that looks like they're up and about and actually accomplishing things?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. There's an older woman who did not drink but just was around last evening who's done most of the cleaning-- and even though there's no reason to clean, she's still just kind of going through the motions of wiping down the counters and putting things away properly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dear heart, um--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Could you spread the word that there's going to be a town meeting?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A town meeting? What for?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we can talk about how to keep everyone safe, dear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. As soon as possible, can everyone meet here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, the central--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In the center of town.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where we killed Kevdak.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where the goliaths, where the barbarians-- sorry, Grog-- where all the mean people were.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right, I'll get the word out." And she puts away a couple of towels and grabs a couple of people near her, and the three of them saunter out into the main walkway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also, I don't know if he remembers, but sometime in our revelry last night, I asked Kerr if he could-- I gave him a sheath, just a sheath of a sword-- and I asked him if he could make just a little-- there's some metal components to it-- I was asking him if he could just make a little secret compartment on it. Like a place that you could hide a little vial or a little powder or a little note or something, just in the side of the sheath.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'm imagining I don't do that much delicate work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. But also, how much did you drink last night?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Oh, right! Yeah, I can totally do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, how much-- how drunk were you?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah, I probably-- I'll take a shot at it. How attached to this sheath are you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (snickers)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Extremely.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'll see what I can do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't make the best decisions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Especially while drinking. You find your way back to your forge, which is still functional. It was not one of the buildings that fell on the initial attack. You heat it up late into the evening. It doesn't require a lot because it's smaller work. Go ahead and make a blacksmithing check with your proficiency bonus. Plus, with this, it would be dexterity. Because it's very, very minute work.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could I have inspired him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could. Yes! You can very much do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will give him a limerick to inspire him with.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Drunken Scanlan limerick, here we go!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go and take your d10 inspiration dice, if you want to add that to the roll.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: All right. So, just proficiency bonus--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus your dex bonus.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah, my vast dex bonus. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16. That's not bad. It's not the finest craftsmanship in the world, and what once was a very, very beautifully detailed sheath to a weapon now has a somewhat hammered, dented element to it that you probably want to hide with a silk or something. It's an imperfection in what was a previously a perfect element, but it is functional. It is a small compartment that actually has a tiny metal slot that can be moved closed or open with your thumb.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Great!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's functional. It's not pretty, but it is functional.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: We focus on function here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And it will explode.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I make a tonic out of the glissfoil that I had in my pouch from the garden back in Emon. Pass it out, a little hangover tonic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It does help, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All of us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sweet!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just a little crushed herbs and water, like a tea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A little hair of the dog, huh?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Kiki!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we day drinking?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also, before we go to the meeting, I haven't used it in a while but I would like to use my Scrying Potion to-- not potion! The scry that I left at our Greyskull Keep so long ago, to kind of see what's going on at Greyskull.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Your scry pie?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing at it this moment now, and it's about midday, you concentrate on what you left behind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep. We all know what it was.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a brief view, a small windowed view of the kitchen before you. It seems to be currently empty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But still standing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But still standing. You do notice, in the sink there are some fresh dishes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Squatters.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fucking squatters.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or maybe our staff.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Unpaid now, so now they're squatters.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) It's an important distinction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you talk through your poop?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a one-way street.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The finer points are lost on me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You left it in the kitchen?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I left it in a jar in the kitchen and I told the people not to open it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is still-- it's been pulled over, it was partially damaged before, but there is a large elevated platform that was used for speeches or celebration elements that has been, for the time being, fixed to allow you guys to stand up if you wish to address the rest of the folks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who wants to talk? Scanlan? You're so charismatic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are we going to say?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm still reading my book. But, yes, we're just going to ask them a question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we need to ask them where they want to go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And if they ask what we think?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't think anything. We'll support their decision, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you think?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess I could talk to them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to build-- The death of a city is such a blasphemy. It is the murder of the dead. And I'm horrified.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy, a city is nothing without living people in it. A city is made up of the people that live inside of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have to protect them first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percival's suggesting letting them live here, building something for them underground--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Which we can facilitate?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Rather than running.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have a lot of other things to do-- let's talk to them.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How about Pike talks to them?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Me?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! You were born here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is true! Pike? They know you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (sighs) Well, I'm not very charismatic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll be with you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But you're genuine.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you want to help me?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Exactly. You are genuine.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So we're telling them-- asking them if they want to stay. And if they do stay, that we could built them shelter.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Help them take shelter in the sewers. If there's danger.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The dragon's dead. We don't know if another one will come.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we ask before we go up on the stage if Kerr, if you're willing to help, should they want that? Is that something you could help us with?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I would be delighted to help facilitate things between you and the community. I know a lot of people that have left will return. I don't doubt that for a second. But right now, everyone is scattered and scared. And a lot of families have been separated. A lot of people who would love to return here and rebuild the city, they don't know where their loved ones are. And I know that is preying on their minds more than their own safety, in some cases. I know most people are looking to leave and come back eventually. And depending on the resources, like what you've generously offered from the caves-- that will keep them from being refugees. They can continue to be a community in this other town, and then return, well-organized and with resources to build it. (sighs) I don't feel they're ready to do it here and now, though. I don't feel they're excited about that. I know that so many of them have people from their lives they're just missing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And by the way, it's going to be a hot second before the carts come back from the cave, right?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah. Probably--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Another day or two before they arrive, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we even say that these people are in--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So are you thinking they won't want to stay, then?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I know from speaking to a lot of people over the last couple of days, and even speaking to them last night, they're relieved that the dragon is gone. But they're worried about more in the future. But primarily, they're looking to be safe now, and reunite with their friends and family, and most of those people are in--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Kymal.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Kymal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Summon them back to rebuild.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How far away is Kymal?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two days' travel.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow. Fucking Shorthalt!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How do you know?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was that in your book?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My girl is there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your daughter's in Kymal?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. I'll be going there anyway.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Haylie? Maylie?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kaylie.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And Kymal hasn't been hit yet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is Kymal bigger or smaller than Westruun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's smaller than Westruun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're better off in Westruun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm afraid with each refugee we add to another city, we're only making it a larger target.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which is why-- (sighs) There is no safe harbor right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And there's no point in rebuilding--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Because this is civilization. This is--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There's no point in rebuilding right now when there's still three other dragons who will only come and go, 'Stomp, stomp, stomp! Dead!'

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They might.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They might.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They. Will.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, they might. We don't know they will.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: If you were a dragon, what would you do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would hit the city where all the refugees are going. Because it would hurt more. I would not hit the city that's going to take 200 years to be a shadow of its former self.

lines.name: MARISHA
