lines.text: Yes, but you're also not a vain dragon who just had one of its allies taken out in this very city. These dragons are going to have a huge vendetta against Westruun now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I may not have lost an ally, but I am a vain dragon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe they will, maybe they won't. How about for those who want to stay, we help build some fortifications. For those who want to leave, we'll protect them on their way there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're at wartime. The people can live underground. For now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And if the dragon comes back, they will be safe underground. And if the dragon doesn't, we have saved thousands of years of inspiration and life. It's-- you can't just abandon something like this! There's too much here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Otherwise, what else are we fighting for?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Otherwise, it becomes our friend Pike from Nowhere.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That would be bad.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That would be bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would be terrible.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scanlan, get their attention.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Get their attention? All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Pike, do you want to step up there?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I'll go, I'll go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I blow my horn to call the meeting to attention.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (horn noise) Everyone gets really quiet. The two of you step up onto the platform--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (airhorn noises)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear one voice in the back go, "That's my "Pike!" As you immediately look over, you see at the far end is Wilhand, leaping up, trying to get a view between the crowd. Everyone's quiet, looking at the two of you, now on top of this platform. Which puts you just over head height from the rest of the folks, by the way.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (stuttering) Hello, everybody from the town.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know I'm not one usually to speak up, but because I know so many of you and some of you are family-- (blows kiss) Um, we-- I'm sure you guys have heard because of the party and festivities from last night, the dragon has been killed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a cheer (crowd cheers), clapping--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And we know that some of you have stayed because if anything else, this is your home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some murmuring.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And some of your family has left for Kymal?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kymal.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Kymal. But we wanted to give you all an option. And for those of you that do want to stay, we would like to provide you with an underground protection of sorts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (whispering and murmuring) Whispers through the crowds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But if you wanted to stay, this would be your best bet. However, we are not forcing you to do anything. If you would like to go with the fellow refugees to Kymal, or find your fellow citizens scattered about, roving in the lowlands, that would be fine too. We need to come to an agreement today, so that we can help you do what

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks like she came from money, but has definitely been pulled down to the same level as the rest of the folks here; they're living in destitution out of necessity. Her hair's trying to be pulled up into a bun, but a lot of it is kind of falling around her face, and she's keeping this kind of poor facade of her previous life. And she stands up: "I myself, my family's history is here in this town and I would be remiss if I didn't express my "hesitation in leaving that behind, for the next roving horde of barbarians to rush in and take "from us while we're away. Especially if this gold is to be retrieved, how do we know how much of that "is to be distributed? How much was my family's versus yours? If we're to divide ourselves at this "point, we're leaving ourselves open to inner conflict, lest we have a very clear idea where "these funds are going. And I, for one, want to make sure I have a home when my family returns. So "I'm not leaving. I'm not going to come back here months down the line and find four layabouts "living in that home, made a complete mess of our things, and telling us it's now theirs. Those who "wish to stay, stand with me." (harrumphs) And she walks offstage, to the side--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to get up on stage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) You don't live here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you. What?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear, "Hmph!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Old magic!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And anything we can do to make this at least livable while it is rebuilt, we will do our best to help. (sighs) It is such a victory for them if Westruun falls. And I sit back down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check with advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a silence in the crowd and people have stopped shuffling from side to side. Some of the folks on the side of the gentleman began to shift back and people tend to stand up. And even the gentleman who was standing at the opposite side kind of ponders for a moment: "Well, regardless of what "happens, we have to get word out. We have to let our loved ones know what has happened, and that "it's safe to come back. If you indeed can help us set this about, I'm confident we can keep out "of sight. At least, hopefully."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While the terrible man and the terrible woman both absolutely have a point--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) He's not that bad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whispers) I'm that bad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whereas I do agree, to an extent, with Percy that we should not let Westruun fall to this, this city is only as great as its people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Woo! Good leadership! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's definitely Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some claps and a few folks kind of agree and nod their heads. The gentleman that you've been talking to kind of looks at you and he's very intently engaged and nodding in agreement.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh. To Westrunn! Huzzah!?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Huzzah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The awkward woman makes a fine point!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The clapping comes together.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, football rules!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pike, do you remember that spell you cast on Greyskull Keep when it got hit by the dragon? The thing you did--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was Divine Intervention, I thought.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was that Divine--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, she summoned a Planar Ally. That one was--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: To help rebuild?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was expensive, wasn't it?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That spell was expensive.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was, like, a thousand gold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was Planar Ally--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What do you want to rebuild? I mean, underground--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Depends on how long you want it to stay. So a task measured in hours requires a thousand gold per hour.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, no, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A task measured in days requires 10,000 gold per day--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (in alarm) No, no, no!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mind you, these entities can do some crazy stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's four days of entities--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I don't want to use up all the-- we can do that after things are--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What else are we going to spend the money on?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can try Divine Intervention again so--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't want to rebuild a city that's going to be stomped by dragons in another three months!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, just the bunker, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just the bunker--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Not the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Keyleth can make the bunker.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For hundreds and hundreds of people?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Honestly, if we take a couple days, I can make a pretty extensive--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to use a previously existing sewer system, and we're just going to reinforce it with pillars and then block off any of the sewage and re-route it, since it doesn't have to handle the load that it used to.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're going to build a vault?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to build a vault.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Talk with your friends and neighbors and come to know your own minds. This is a decision that has to be made soon, but not on the spur of the moment. Thank you for coming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One man in the front, an old friend of yours, his name is Joseph, puts his hand up, "Kerrek! Of which mind are you? Are you staying or are you going? Are you going to escort, go along "as an escort with this woman, or are you staying to protect us? Where you walk, I walk."

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: If--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What we need is a decision."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone should stay here. Everyone should be a unit, a cohesive unit. And we: me, Keyleth, and one of your own, Pike, will definitely travel to Kymal to spread the word, if you give us a list of your ancestors, family members, friends, we can get word to all of them very quickly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone in the crowd seems to nod, and the gentleman kind of nods his head to you, "All right." (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're a monster.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Since you haven't been as present in the community for a while, if I am sure that things are adequately defended here, I might go myself to ensure the proper apportionment of funds and to talk to those of our townsfolk who have already left, and perhaps organize them a little more effectively so that they can return.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (huffs) "Well, have no other choice, do we?" Everyone nods, and they look up to the rest of you. Look to you. "Then let's begin building."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Bunker it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: As all that starts to wind down, I ask my sister to point me towards Reginald's daughter.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you see her?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The one with the nice hair?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that one. And the giant bag of gold.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I seek her out in the crowd.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's still looking up, kind of by herself in the crowd, clapping off to the side as you approach.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to hang near him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excuse me, young miss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes? Hi."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry. We haven't spoken, but you spoke to my friends. You spoke to my sister. My sister looks very much--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can see the similarity, yes."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know the news they delivered to you. I am so sorry for your loss. Your father was very brave at the end. Impressively so, and I want you to know that. I've also recovered his body, and I thought to add him to the pyres that this city did outside the city, but I thought maybe you had a family plot or somewhere you'd prefer him to be laid to rest. I'll gladly take him there for you, or take him with you. Whatever you prefer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll come with you. I'd like to see him one last time. We have no family plot. We were meager "folk. But he spent most of his life working in that field. I think it's only fitting that's where "he spends the rest of his days. Show me." And as you guys begin the building process, she follows you out to the field where she is shown the body of Reginald, and she takes a moment of quiet with him, and cradles his body. But there's a smile on her face, and she says thank you for letting her say goodbye face to face. With your help, you both bring the body back to the farmhouse where you had first met, and you spend the rest of the day interring his body within the hillside that is buttressed against the actual farmland that he tilled.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To lose a parent before their time is no easy thing. I'm very sorry for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's all right. He did good."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That he did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Let's go ahead and make sure the rest of these folk have more to look forward to, shall we?" She looks at you for a second, and you can see she takes a general scope of your expression and your emotional state, and even for a young girl, she has a stronger insight than you expected, and she puts her arm out and touches your shoulder and says, "You carry too much "sadness with you. You've done a lot of good. Let yourself-- Let yourself understand and accept the "fact that you've done a lot of good." And she starts walking back towards the town.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I linger for a bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you feel like this is doing some good for these folks at the very least. Whenever you guys would like to take your journey--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to do a couple things just to the room before we do anything other than this to our houses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Certainly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And on the other wall start--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In Draconian.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Terrible person. And on the other wall, start carving in the story of--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Those we've lost? That's not what you were going to say.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What we've done to save the city, and where the story, and where the city came from, and what has happened, and make a place where other people, they can start carving in also the history and everything they need to say about the city, just one of the giant walls, I just want to start filling in with stories of the city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and this catches your attention too, because as pragmatic an individual as Percy is, this is a strangely artistic endeavor of his point, at least the intent behind it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You disagree with my opinions.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't really agree with immortalizing ourselves in stone--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not about us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: --way before we're even dead--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How long do you live?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I complete my journey, it could be upward of a thousand years or more.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How long do you think I live?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Less than a hundred? If you're lucky.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs) I am Percival Fredrickstein Von Musel Klossowski de Rolo III.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No kidding.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My ancestry dates back thousands of years and will continue for thousands more, unless Whitestone falls. I live as long as Whitestone lives. This place is the human soul. This is what we have built with our tiny moments. To lose a place like this, we don't feel it immediately, but it would ruin everyone in small ways.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not all of us are lucky enough to have a lineage in a name.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not all of us are lucky enough to have a lineage in a lifespan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not many of us are lucky enough to have a lineage at all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which is why we save everyone we can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess that is one thing we can both agree on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is good we're doing here. This is great good. And it's not about idolizing ourselves; it's about a very long story, which we are, even you, a tiny part of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this moment, you look down and notice that, while you guys were having this talk, a small child has walked up to the wall and where Percy has stopped the carving, the child has picked up a piece of wayward chalk that was on the ground and has begun to draw little stick figures on the wall where you stopped. And in a little bit of the quiet, he stops and looks up over his shoulder at the two of you and smiles, and then just goes back to writing on the wall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He'll outlive you, right there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, no, you're probably right. Look at him. I guess this little guy is like the moment encapsulated. Hey, bud.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (kid voice) That's a octopus!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (kid voice) That's a shark. This is a flower.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (kid voice) This a bear!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I give Keyleth a little hug.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pikey-pants. Do you want to have gone to Kymal? Or do you want to have stayed and helped?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Didn't you volunteer me to help?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I volunteered you to come with me to Kymal.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll go with you to Kymal.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll come along to chaperone. No, I'm kidding.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Oh, so these two things are happening simultaneously?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are these two things happening simultaneously?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is up to you guys. The Kymal journey--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a couple days.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A couple days and back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, not according to druidic spells.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah. You could bamf us there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which is what I assumed you were referring to about instantaneous travel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At some point we should put a teleport circle in this, down here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would probably be smart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you would have to contact an arcane practitioner.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Somebody else is going to do this. We've got shit to do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's bamf in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go do it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're all going to go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you would like to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to stay and help build.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, Scanlan, Pike, and Keyleth, you're going with them?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess so. You guys are going to need me to get back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Unless I can get you there, and then you can walk back. Fly there, walk back. Or you can--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Teleport.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can you fly?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can fly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can mist form us, and then we can get there in how many hours?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mist form, you'd get there in under a day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Teleporting is more fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what are you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Teleport them there, and then they can get back on their own.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, we can get back on our own. It's two days.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They just killed a dragon, they'll be fine. What's a bandit going to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have fun, you gnomes! (magic crackle)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. She finds one of the surface trees just outside of the sewage system. As she touches her hands to its bark, the bark cracks and splits open, revealing the doorway behind it, about five foot of internal wood tunnel leads to an opposing side that opens into what immediately is a tent city on the outside walls of Kymal. You guys quickly step through with the moments you have before the portal slams shut.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: High five! High five!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Asshole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do get a little tag from Pike right before it shuts.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah! Scanlan, you suck! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are now standing on the outside of a small cluster of trees outside of Kymal. The mountain range behind it, you can see, there are hundreds and hundreds of people that are displaced in the outside of the city in tents.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Before-- because assuming it's been, it sounds like a couple of days, if there's walls and artistry happening, have the wagons gotten back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They have, actually, yes.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And if there are those resources, and I know that this trip is happening, I've got to go across and make sure that my people aren't dying of dysentery.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're coming?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a high five tag to Keyleth as Pike jumps through, and before it slams shut, Kerr goes, "Wait!" and jumps through after.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, this is great. It's great to have an old dude with us also.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I do think it's great!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Two old dudes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's so much that I wanted to talk to you about, Kerr! I'm so glad that you came along!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (grumbles) (laughter)

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: There's important work to be done here.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There is very important work to be done, and I feel like we all need to focus on that, and get down to the nitty-gritty of it, you know?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's go, let's walk!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go spread the good word about Westruun, and the great things happening in sewers there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys begin to make your way from tent to tent, finding individuals, many of which you recognize. Some have recognition of you, and there's a brief little discussion of what's happened, what's transpired, and you tell them of the fall of Umbrasyl, of the herd being sundered and sent westward, and making sure, as Scanlan would, that Vox Machina is responsible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. And that it rhymes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: People are in this holding pattern, waiting to hear any news. And the news that you bring does bring hope to the eyes of those that do speak with you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Take a tiny bit in it, wrap it in a little bit of parchment, stick it in the secret compartment of the hilt of the sword.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The scabbard, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The classiest of magic practitioners, Scanlan Shorthalt. You do so. Like spackling a wall, you fill the compartment affixed within the scabbard without issue.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shove that dingleberry in there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fresh blueberry sherbet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, so we've spread the good word. Are people going to travel back, do you think?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Most of the people you talk to are intent on returning, because this living situation is only going to be so good for so long.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hope we're not sentencing them to death.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To be fair, the town you're currently in could be gone next week.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Either way.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I know what's needed back there. I've got access to money. They have wagons and labor. I know most of the people in town, so I'm not going to do it myself, but I know who-- honestly, anyone who runs a farm is a better organizer than any modern small business owner.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is very true.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: So I will talk to a few of these old, capable farmer types and say, okay, here's the money. You know how to bargain. Do your business, and we can get together and we'll head back all together. As soon as you can get everyone together and all that. Also, I'll put somebody in charge of making sure that we're bringing in food, and I'll do a scan around and make sure that people literally aren't dying of dysentery. That they have a clean well and all of that stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. I mean, there is disease, as tends to happen when you have people who are displaced and clustered like that in sub-par living conditions, but no major pandemics that are kicking through the people there. The people who are sick are being tended to, and there are people who are medically practiced, or at least herbalists and such, that can help with that. You find a slight group of trustworthy individuals that you know would do well and understand the process, and with the mere inclusion of a few thousand gold, would be more than enough to be able to purchase from the interior of Kymal enough oxen, horses, and other beasts to bring most of the current carts back with you. That was the only real barrier, because Kymal was like, "We can't help you guys "for free." Now there's gold, people are like, "Oh! Well, let's talk." Charity only goes so far. But you do feel through this trip that you've definitely made an impact, and most of the people, at least over the next week or so, will be outfitted with the proper materials, food for the journey, and be able to make their way back towards Westruun.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I will also go to look for Dr. Dra and Kaylie at some point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an investigation check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll go with him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dranzel, who is limping alongside her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh God! Is he okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can go and ask.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go and ask!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're walking across the street. They haven't noticed you yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oi! Shorthalt!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a stop, and Kaylie turns her head.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's good."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You, too. How's he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's got a foot infection, nothing too great to look about." You look down and his left foot is all swollen. He's like, "I've had worse!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike has healed feet before.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: May I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please. Be my guest." As the half-orc grins with his hat still floppy on his head, he presents his horrible foot that gives off a delightful smell of putrescence.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: While she works on him, I'm going to take Kaylie off to the side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's easy enough for you to cleanse elements of disease with minor healing. We'll say for the purposes of this, through a couple of low-level spells you're able to pretty much take care of his foot entirely. He's like, "That's incredible! I mean, if you ever need a traveling troupe, we're "always looking for someone to keep us on the up and up! Can you cure hangovers?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, hang with me, young Pike!" While this is happening, you turn to Kaylie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm so happy that you are alive and safe, and I came a great distance to do other things, but mainly to see you, and I just wanted to say a few things before I go off to complete my mission. You know, I know I'm not the father that you wanted, but I'm the father that you have, and I'm sorry. I just wanted to tell you that I've been doing a lot of thinking about you, and me, and where I fit in to the life of a family man. Most of my adult life, I've been longing for a gnome to care for, and I met a really good one, and she's here and her name is Pike. And she's beautiful and wonderful, and possibly my soulmate, but I've learned that she's not my family and never will be. You're the gnome that I'm to care for forever, and I'm doing something very stupid now with my friends. We're going to try to save the world. And I didn't know why, but now I know, and if we die doing it, it will be for a good thing, and if we don't, then, well, I'll find you, and I'll be whatever kind of father you need me to be. One who's close and helpful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She shushes you. Puts her finger up and shushes you, then steps up and looks at you. The hardness in her face softens, and there is a little bit of tears gathering at the edge of her eyes when she says, "Don't you die. You stay alive."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't intend to. But you know, I was just inside a--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're. Not. Going. To die. You're going to go do your stupid world-saving mission like you "told me, and you're going to come back, and we're going to have a lot to talk about."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Can you do that for me?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I promise you. I promise you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll hold you to that."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I got you a present. It's a ring. It's a beautiful ring because you're a beautiful girl, and I'd like you to keep it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She takes it and looks at it and goes, "Are you sure this wasn't for someone else?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. Never.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She puts it on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And you're also strong, and you'll need this sword. And I give her my Singing Dawn Blade, which has a unique little imperfection at the bottom of it, and I say, this sword has killed a king, which makes it almost worthy enough for you. I hope that it keeps you safe until I can see you again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know what to say. I'll start with thank you. Well, I feel pretty well protected."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Get out of here. If you can, try to make your way to Vasselheim. There's three more dragons, and it'll be a while before I kill them all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll talk it over with the doctor. See what he's interested in. You promised."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gnome's honor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She reaches up and grabs your shirt and gives you a kiss on the forehead. And then pushes you away and says, "Get out of my fucking face." Turns around and walks back towards Dr. Dranzel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, Pike, I'm done.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But she's not done! You're sticking with us, right?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't think I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, I know. I'm just-- I try."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But you guys are headed to-- Where are you headed to? Where are you going to go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I don't know! I figure we can-- based on what we're hearing around here, folks are heading "back to Westruun. They probably need some cheering up on the road. From there, who knows? Actually, "I've never been to Marquet before, but I'm thinking--" At this point, Kaylie comes up and goes, "Let's have a talk. I'm feeling a bit of religion coming on. Perhaps we should look further "west. Northwest. Vasselheim. Not a lot of music in those parts. They'll be willing to pay for that, I "assume." He's like, "Vasselheim? It's cold there, isn't it? Let's get some furs." They both start walking away from you guys.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Before they go, I just reach out my hand and introduce myself to Kaylie. I've heard many lovely things about you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks at you guardedly and takes your hand. "As I've heard of you. He made a promise."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll make sure that he keeps it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you." They keep walking. So, with the money dispersed, the group having a returning sense of hope, with materials, goods, food being redistributed amongst the refugees, it appears there is a direction for the future of Westruun that you've set into place. As you guys gather the rest of your things, Keyleth, you take an evening's rest with the troupe, and the next morning return back to Westruun.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Something I wanted to do last night. In all the hubbub that's going on in Westruun, I spend some time to find my sister, and I wanted to stealth up on her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easy enough to do while they're out and about taking their rest with the group in Kymal, while you guys are still helping rebuilding. So yes, go ahead and make a stealth check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm just reading these names on this wall!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your passive perception?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hear a few very, very faint, very familiar steps come across the stones behind you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pretend like I don't hear them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your hair looks like shit, sit down. I start braiding it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love you too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Elaina would be proud of you. I'm proud of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's worth more.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Saved my life again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I crawled out through an arrow hole.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought it was probably you. Tiny little you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a bit of chicken here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, ow!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One day at a time, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One day at a time. Ow!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anything else you wish to take care of before you continue your journey?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a small package and letter that I want to deliver to Kerr before we leave, but other than that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A Kerr package?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. I was hoping, I was really hoping, someone would say that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I would like to pull Kerr aside and say, you know these people here, they're a bit lost, and they need a leader.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah, they absolutely do. We'll see if we can find them one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just something to think about.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I've thought about it. But no. But you're very kind. You know, over-- How long has this been going on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going on the better part of two weeks since the initial dragon attack. A little over two weeks, maybe, by now.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: You're making something. And sometimes it doesn't seem to balance out that scale very well, but that's all you can do. And sometimes all you can do is be around for people while they make things, because you can't do everything.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, Kerr, I'm certainly glad that you showed up in my life, in this time, when I am building this-- whatever the hell this is. Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've made you something, if you will accept it. We pull out a small wooden box that we put together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I put some Ashari decorative stuff around it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So the box itself is wooden, but there is fresh, living ivy curled across it with a few bursts of beautiful red flowers on each side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Totally. What's the flower of Westruun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The flower of Westruun would actually be the white iris, which grows around the western side of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Beautiful. It's covered in white irises.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You sick fuck. You're amazing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, the white iris. No big deal. It's the white iris.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Talk Westruun to me.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'll--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spring snakes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (water bottle falls off the table loudly)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Spring snakes!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Trying to have a moment, thank you.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Have I got the first clue?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The parchment will explain everything and how to use them, but this circlet and this bracelet will help make you a champion that can help protect this city now. And should the need arise, this circlet will give you control of the body of a creature that will help.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: His name's Fassbender. And he's got an awesome mustache. And the bracelet's kind of just a bracelet, but I made it. It might be a friendship bracelet.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: I'll put that on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It might say "friendship" in Ashari.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The circlet will, if anything, if the need ever arises, it will be something that will help protect the city. The scroll will explain the particulars.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you go up by the funeral pyres, where we set the trap, you'll find him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've already moved him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy will tell you where he is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's in the scroll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just read the directions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you read the scroll, glance over it, and you may have seen this entity walking in their vicinity once or twice during the time you met them. It is a 12 foot tall stone golem. It is explained in this that with the use of this circlet, you have control over this creature.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And if I have anything to say about it, it will be a very, very long time. So thank you. Thank you for them, and thank you for me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I give Kerr a big hug.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Free hug!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I watch awkwardly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. As you guys break your hug, you look down.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to miss you, Kerr.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it's okay, you don't have to say it back.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: You know where I am. It could be that I will see you before too long. Some of us have more time than others, of course.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sure I will see you at some point later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you step away and turn back to the wall, which is mostly done carving with the names and the story bits you and Percy have been working on during this time, that child has returned, and is still drawing with the chalk, and as you look down at the stick figures, you can see one with antlers, two that are smaller than the others, one that is larger than the rest, burlier, thicker around the chest, one that you can barely see, and one that flies across them all on a broom. And then, at the very end, just finishing, one with funny glasses. The kid stands up and looks at it once and goes, "It's done!" And then runs off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, dear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just take a little piece of chalk and I add Trinket right on the other side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Much better drawn than the rest of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Almost perfect. Almost perfect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can be right every now and then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hate you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) So what's your next step?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have more Vestiges to get. An airship to steal.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Please?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Vasselheim?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have to go to Vasselheim.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vasselheim is so far away, and the Feywild is so very close.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have to go to the water tribe of the Ashari.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The Feywild is close.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have to go to Vasselheim now, and I will go on my own if I have to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's why.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's definitely where all the Vestiges are currently held. There is all those locations. So what is your next step in the journey?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why do you need to go back to Vasselheim? Right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not done with her.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think I know why he needs to go back to Vasselheim.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's not my place to say.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have to go now. Whether it's just me-- Pike, I would be grateful if you would go with me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I'm going with you, too.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't think that this is somewhere that you can go with me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vasselheim? I've been there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, you can go to Vasselheim, but what I have to do there, I don't want you to have any part of it. Just this. Just this one thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, then I'll go to Vasselheim and I'll wait outside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I need you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I take him and I pull him aside. I know that you've been avoiding me. And I just have to say, I don't know who this-- I don't know who or what this Raven Queen is, and I think that's what scares me the most. But I know if you're choosing a life of faith or whatever you want this to be, I'm happy for you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take her by the hand and I pull her further away. Much further away. Did the others tell you what happened in the tomb? In the sunken tomb?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm getting bits and pieces.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have been avoiding you. Percival-- There was a trap, and Vex'ahlia-- I almost lost Vex'ahlia, and a woman appeared. Not a woman. A god appeared. She appeared, and I did something. I tried to save my sister. I did something stupid. I tried to bargain. I didn't even fucking want the armor that I'm wearing right now! I didn't want it. I don't think I've ever told you how much I admire you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I always have. You have a kindness about you that comes with such ease and honesty. You have always carried a light. Her light. I think, you know, I admire everyone in our band of misfit toys, but you most of all, and when you left, we all noticed its absence. All of us. I think I wanted to find it again for myself. Hers. Your benefactor. I felt Her, and I told myself that when you came back, I was going to come to you and I was going to learn from you, and follow you and follow Her. As soon as you came back. And like so many things that I reach for in this life, it slipped through my fingers, and I've gone and painted myself into a corner. I can't anymore. And I think when I saw you, it was just a reminder of what I lost. I'm sorry for avoiding you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Don't be sorry. I understand now. And I don't think that you're lost in any way. I think if you felt in some way that this is who you've needed to follow, then follow her.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, the bottom line is I couldn't walk away if I wanted to, because I know that I would lose my sister. But I don't want to anymore. We've all been close to death, all of us, and now I'm just a little bit closer. It took me a bit, but maybe we're not meant to be happy. I don't know.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't think that's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I don't know. But I know that I can be of use.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You can be, and you are of use. I'm not the type of person who would ever say that you have to choose and follow who I follow, but I will tell you now that if the Raven Queen fucks with you, or hurts you, or doesn't change you for the better, then she's going to have to deal with me, and we're going to have a problem. But as of right now, I love you, Vax. It is going to be fine, and I am here for you, no matter what, and you can talk to me any time. Don't be ashamed or embarrassed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was. I'm doing better.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Don't be ashamed. And turn that frown upside down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It would help if you stayed around.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But maybe you'll discover that with the Raven Queen. Maybe she'll take you to jobs and you just have to go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Prime Time.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But I adore you. Okay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was all kinds of fucked up a couple of weeks ago.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, you are all kinds of fucked up all the time, and that's why we love you. We're all all kinds of fucked up, and that's why we all are together.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I walk by, eating chicken and wearing no pants.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: See? And I give him a slap on his bare ass as he walks by. You okay? You will be.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ish.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ish. That's all we can be, is ish. Okay?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To the Feywild!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To where?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He needs a destination.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What is your next plan of action?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to Vasselheim.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: God damn it. To Vasselheim!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To Vasselheim, then.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If emo elf is going to Vasselheim, we're going to Vasselheim.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can go. I can catch up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can't go by yourself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we have the rocks. We could send a rock with him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's fucking stupid. I'm going. I wouldn't let him go to Vasselheim.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're all going to Vasselheim.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have things I can do in Vasselheim.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's the only bastion of standing civilization left.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is Feywild on the way?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it's in the opposite direction. It's south of here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's another plane.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, let's go on the way. It's like on the way, practically.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we know an entrance to the Feywild in the Frostweald.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are many doors to the Feywild throughout the world. You just only know one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's just let Vax go by himself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, there's actually things that can be done in Vasselheim.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I pull Vax aside.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Christ.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, you had two hours to beat the shit out of a goliath! Sit tight, buddy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I pull Kerr aside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pull Grog aside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I walk away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Catch phrase! Catch phrase! Meme! Tweet tweet tweet!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. As Keyleth pulls you aside.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you want to go alone? Do you want to go by yourself? Because if you want to go by yourself, say something, and we'll let you go. If you think this is something you need to do by yourself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm actually scared shitless, and I would like Pike and you to go with me. I would like my sister not to go anywhere near her. That's what I would like, and that's it. You and Pike.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then say something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, you didn't.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keyleth, can you open up a hole in a tree? We can go quick. Everyone can go to Vasselheim. There's just a specific place in Vasselheim that I need to go. And I love you, but I just don't want you to be a part of it. You either hang out with Grog, or stay outside, okay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To Vasselheim!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To Vasselheim.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To outside a building in Vasselheim.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To a far wooded area where magic is permissible, outside of Vasselheim.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Divine magic is permissible. The essence of pulling magic beyond the powers. It's the arcane practitioning that is frowned upon. It's not illegal. It's just generally frowned upon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's rude.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we'll end tonight's game. Picking up next week, at that moment. Thank you guys so much, that was a great session! Dude, Patrick, thank you so much for joining us!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Patrick, my new best friend!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Kerr Bear!

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Thanks so much for having me. I've been a fan for a long time. It was a real treat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dude, our pleasure, man. Thanks for coming.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: As we have been of you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kerr Bear Share!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And thanks, Loot Crate!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And thanks Loot Crate, for deciding to sponsor us again! And thank you guys for being so supportive of us having sponsors now! It's really, really helpful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Use the link! Show your Critter power!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It makes us feel like we're a grown up show now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're a real Twitch stream!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're a real Twitch stream with sponsors!

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Is it gauche if I mention a thing that's going on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, please, go for it!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are you, a sellout? Come on, man.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: There's a subtle difference between selling and selling out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly. You're fine.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: And I'm constantly pushing that border. I run a charity called World Builders, and we raise money to support various charities. We rally the geek community, and right now we're running our midseason fundraiser. It's an Indiegogo with a bunch of cool things that geeks might like. We teamed up with Rat Queens. We're doing a T-shirt for them. If you're a fan of the Dresden Files, we've got a T-shirt based on Harry Dresden and those books. We've got a T-shirt based on my books. We've got, literally, there's 40 items there, a bunch of different cool geekery of various sorts. For those of you that have read The Slow Regard of Silent Things, they pulled off a foxen night light. It looks beautiful. I should've brought the prototype so I could show it to you. I should've brought the prototype, but it turned out so good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to look it up.

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: The thing is, it only lasts for four more days. This is just a weeklong fundraiser. You can get coffee, you can get hoodies, you can get a bunch of these things, and all the money goes to charity. If you're interested, swing on by and take a peek at what we've got. If there's any of my people in the Twitch stream, which I'm guessing there are, you can throw a link up there so other people can see it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's that web address again?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: If you search on worldbuilders.org, that's our main web page. This fundraiser in particular is happening on Indiegogo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus there's a link in your Twitter account, right?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: Yeah, I've been talking about it in my Twitter account, and I do occasionally Twitch stream, too, and I throw up the link there as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And what is your Twitter account, just so folks know?

lines.name: PATRICK
lines.text: @patrickrothfuss, just all together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. Fantastic. Thank you guys again, a great session tonight, and yeah. I guess we'll see you guys in a week. Until then, we ask ourselves: Is it Thursday yet? Have a good night, guys!
